comments:
ant.ui requires jdt.ui, but it defines a second "Format" command and places it 
in the "Source" category.  This means that it is very hard to display in the 
keys preference page.  The only translated piece of text that distinguishes 
them is the description.  A description is hard to show in a list. 
 
The recommended way to use commands is to have one command for every semantic 
(e.g., format) and then provide your own handler within the appropriate 
application context (e.g., editor, view, etc.). 
 
It also makes it challenging for users to change the format key binding.  If a 
user wants F11 to be format and every editor provided their own format 
command, then they have to go around and change every editor's format key 
binding. 
 
It would be nice if ant.ui simply used the jdt.ui format.
*** Bug 118080 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Appears to simply need to remove the Ant UI definition and things just work...

Removed the command and binding declaration from Ant UI plugin.xml
Removed the nls from plugin.properties

Verified that command and binding are gone. 
Note that format is current mapped to Ctrl-Shift-F instead of Command-Shift-F. See bug 67099.

Missed the setting of the actionDefinitionId for the created in the context menu of the Ant editor....released the change to the Ant editor to get rid of:
